game-hours: 1414.8
review: I highly recommend DotA 2, and for good reason. I've played a stupid amount of the game, to be honest, so I thought I might as well write about my opinions of it. Great Points: 1. Great replayability 2. Really fun with friends 3. Great joys when you pull off that amazing move 4. Really, really high skill ceiling 5. Over 105 heroes to play, most with a unique style of play accompanied with them 6. Huge amount of items to select from 7. The casual player has a spot in this, too, thanks to the new system! 8. Ranked Matchmaking vs. Non-Ranked matchmaking, and a punishment for abandoning Some down-points 1. The entry barrier: a. Its similar to a C b. Once you pass the bubble, its easy to get better, but passing the outer shell is the hard part. 2. Community a. A lot of the community is really annoying, mean, and sometimes downright cruel. I find that this is about 10-20% of the community, and I find one in every 3 games or so. b. These people usually try to play low-skill heroes and blame you for making mistakes even if the mistake is theirs, regardless of their status in the relationship. c. Sometimes language barriers make the game far less entertaining, with the majority of minority languages not being on the list for language preferences 3. The lopsided nature of the game a. Unless you find yourself being amazing, most games tip in the first five minutes and the team that tipped it either turns it around immediately or they lose, with only a few exceptions that lead to fantastic games. Now then, Ive gushed and ranted about the game enough, Ill go explain the basic concepts of Dota 2, if you plan to get in on the action but arent sure if it's worth your time yet. A. There are three lanes, considered either hardlane/offlane, mid, or safelane, and these differ where they are depending upon your faction. B. There are two factions in DotA  one is based in the upper right hand corner of the map, known as the Dire, and the other team is in the lower left hand corner of the map, known as the Radiant. C. After initial hero selection is finished, with one of the many gamemodes a. Random Draft (20 heroes, cycles between teams to pick heroes in groups of two/one at a time) b. All Pick (Everyone picks any hero they wish all at once) c. Captains Mode - A Captain selects heroes and bans heroes, taking turns with the opposing team) d. Captains Draft - 24 heroes, see Captains Mode for rest) e. All Random - Everyone gets a random hero, my personal favorite, especially for learning all the heroes all over again) f. Least Played - Every person picks from all the heroes, minus their 40 most played. Also good for learning, but not the best.) g. Limited Heroes  Everyone picks from a pool of heroes chosen by Valve which generally have a lower skill ceiling and are easier to play than regular heroes. Some people say this is best for learning, but I find that these heroes leave a bad impression of DotA, due to the cheap nature of some of the heroes. h. Single Draft  Everyone picks from three random heroes, one with an agility specialty, one with a strength specialty, and one with an intelligence specialty. i. Occasionally, special events happen from time to time during holidays, but those are ignored for the purpose of this review. D. After loading the game, you normally will either select a build you made yourself, or using the book icon in the top left hand corner of the screen, you can select a build someone else made that was reviewed by the community as either good or bad, and they can help eliminate the initial difficulty if youre new to this hero. E. Once the first minute or so is finished, creep waves begin to spawn. They consist of three melee creeps, and one ranged creep, which slowly increase in power throughout the game, until they hit a cap. Creeps run at normal speed in the hard-lane and the mid-lane, but faster in the safe-lane so that creeps end up towards the middle of the lane, as opposed to being lopsided. F. Towers defend major points in the waves, and award money for being killed. You can also earn money by being the person to get the last hit on creeps. G. Different people talk about different phases of the game, but essentially there are two different phases, with sub-phases in between, or inside. a. Laning Phase  A distribution of heroes goes to the different lanes to kill creeps, gain experience, and earn money. b. Team fight Phase  All the heroes go together to throw spells and attacks at each other. After that, its just a combination of a bunch of the events previously described  thats DotA in a nutshell. Now, why would you want to play a game that resets all your progress after you finish a match? Well, in my opinion, it means that nobody ever has a major advantage over another player, such as PvP in other online games with loot-driven systems. You can meet new people, make friends, and have a new experience every single game. With 106 heroes as of this patch, theres somewhere around 1.1e20s worth of possible matchups. Theres many roles to be played, and much fun to be had. Now, if Ive convinced you  Go play dota! And if I somehow didnt convince you, then go enjoy whatever game it is you play. And apologies for the formatting, steam review's lack of HTML formatting made it a little harder!

game-hours: 1777.6
review: Started out playing DotA on the old WC3 engine and I played that for 7+ years before I shifted into Dota 2 with the beta. Dota 2 offers much more than the original WC3 version in terms of graphics and gameplay, as the old engine's hero and skill interactions were hampered by limitations (DotA Allstars was just a custom map). Cosmetics, tournaments, and streaming are all seamlessly integrated; and are constantly being improved at the behest of the community. The game is a bit hard to get into at first, but after you have the basics down, you'll play for an innumerable amount of time. Adding friends into the mix for crazy strategies and plays increases the replayability and enjoyment of the game to another level. One of the best games. EVER.

review: Everytime something is about to happen in real life, I always say to myself, GLHF (Good Luck, Have Fun). This game's community has helped me motivate myself in real life. If it wasn't for that acronym, I would be having more worries and stress over simple things. Two dota 2 games (not necessarily every day) a day is a good dosage of having fun and keeping up with your social life. I've been playing this game since it came out 2011 and that's where the 2000+hrs came. I won't say I didn't get hooked. I did, 'cause I had nothing to do in summers when I was still schooling, but now I'm a busy man and this is like where I vent my frustrations. 9/10. GL HF!

game-hours: 495.2
review: I've spent 435 hours in this game at the time of this review. That equates to roughly 18 days, or just over half a month. It is far and away my most played game on Steam (my next most played game is TF2 with 150-some hours), which doesn't even compare. This game is hard. Possibly the most complicated thing I've ever done in these 18 days is walking in front of NPC units as they walk across the map and stopping periodically so that they have to stop to - thereby allowing me to attack the enemy's units at a safer area relative to my side of the map. This game is more than just a game I play - I can also watch games from within the client, both from my friends and from professional DotA 2 teams. The International, a Valve-created tournament held in Seattle, will this year have a prizepool of over TEN MILLION dollars (mostly funded by the community). The hats and other accessories in this game are also spectacular - I sometimes wonder whether I'm playing a game where I viciously kill different creatures on a battlefield, or one where I play dress-up with oddly disfigured digital dolls. Although if you don't want to spend your days getting flamed you should probably pick up this game at the same time as four other friends. tl;dr - Community (at least in the metagame) is good. Valve is good. Game is great. Play with friends.

game-hours: 10.1
review: Very simple and Very complicated at the same time. This game gives you opportunity to play special hero-character selected from huge list of heroes. Simple side of the game: - 2 opposite bases. To win you need to capture one. - 5 players Vs 5 players. Empty slot(s) to be played by GameBot. - Pick a hero, push Battle. Thats it. Complicated side of the game. - You need to know Hero you playing and how level him in details. - You need to have at least 1 nonBot friend playing with you to get Win or to resist at random games. - You need to know what duo of heroes is a good hero-combo and what duo is suck hero-combo. - You need to know when/where and what to buy. - You need to know how to read tha map, where to push, where to defend. How and when to do it right. - You need to know how to farm coins and exp fast to get advantage and buy things for yourself at later stage of round. You need to know all above for 100% to get good Win/Loose statictic. And yeah,,,be ready to read a lot of crap from "zombie" players, who lives in Dota 2 for years. For example, i've tryed to play normal match at my very first time and I've read a lot of new thigs abt myself. Even after passing through all training matches/tests and its your first Player vs Player match. Ignore all chat crap & Have fun!

game-hours: 1234.2
review: This is a great game, the graphics are good, the sound atmospheric, the game play is clean and fun, and the heros are enjoyable and at some moments funny. However the game lacks in some area, some heros are far better then others when you play on a public server, i.e. (Sniper, Riki, and Bloodseeker) just to name a few, all these heros can be countered easily, but with an incompetant team they'll become gods on the battlefield, also the tutorial teaches bad habits i.e. (Only teaching you how to fight in the middle lane, poor hero selection, and no team building tutorial). Altogether this game is great, it is outstanding how open ended the battles can be, every game is different, and you're never left unsatisfied. I give this game a 9/10

review: Graphics: 10/10 Story: - Gameplay: 10/10 I dont know where to begin, I am near to 3k hours played, and intended to move on.. You must already saw how the game is played through videos or read it from somewhere, its MOBA. But, why 8 million people play same map, over and over, and never bored. Here comes the epic truth; yes, we play same map every game, but never played same game once in my life. The choices you made, the hero picks and item builds made it a whole different game. It also enables communication with different cultures, (very minor but it does) and improves your sense of team play. Its graphics are good and supported by poor graphic cards also. There is no story behind it, however there are character bio's in learn section of game. This game is highly recommended, but beware, once you are in, you are in. There is no exit! GL & HF

review: Very balanced moba no doubt, very flexible with multiple mechanics. Community isnt 5 stars but could be much worse for my moba's experience, atleast low priority system works well. Easy and Hard Heros for all types of players, you will learn to all with time. Huge price Pools for serious tournaments, very competitive, each year we found out new tactics from the world top teams/ players. Adapt your item build to the situation (enemy and friendly teams) and to the time of the game, not a base build that everyone uses all the time in that hero. Try to abuse mechanics like force staff and BS ulti. "Skin" system is amazing because you can create custom sets and you can trade or itens with other players to avoid money wastes, but i recommend to go to trade life only if you know the market and how to deal with scammers. Overall if you this game is to much for you, go play LoL, simple as that plastic kid cup with a straw that cant use a f***ing glass, because they can "cut" then selfs with a "complex" glass. review: Dota 2 is not going to be for everyone due to the skill level needed as well as the tactics needed to play the game. People coming from League of Legends may have a hard time playing this game because of the different mechanics, so expect to do well just because your level 15 in LoL. This game is the original Dota in a more up to date form. Dota 2 is rising in the competitive arena as MLG is just taking it under its wing in the recent MLG Columbus Championship, as well as Dota 2 being played at Dreamhack Winter 2013 for the first time. If you want to play a competitive MOBA with a better community (imo) than LoL, then shoot for this game. It is the next step in terms of skills needed.

game-hours: 2264.2
review: best part
game-hours: 191.7
review: Dota 2 does many things right. With Free-2-play attitude, a vast selection of over 100 playable heroes and a massive fanbase, it's easy to see why Dota 2 is one of the fastest growing communities in gaming. However, not all is fine and dandy. The game punishes the slightest mistake with characters becoming unkillable and downright overpowered. Take for example Bloodseeker, if he gets even one kill he can dominate a game. New players are funneled into playing these easy or overpowered heroes making the game unenjoyable for the other players. While *t does happen, the game is still an enjoyable experience provided that the super-strong characters (that definently need a nerf) are kept under wraps by repeatedly killing them or the aren't selected in the game you're playing. I would recommend it just don't expect it to a breeze.

game-hours: 680.2
review: Amazing :v
game-hours: 175.4
review: First and foremost, this is a "Team" game, if you come in expecting to be the "star" maybe you should rethink your expectations about this game. One thing to take in account is that everyone has a role, and sometimes the ones that you less expect can be the most important ones. As an example, a game can be decided by who has the most map control, and in general support roles are the ones in charge of this. Supports play a very important, yet silent part in this game. Remember, it's a "Team" effort, if one fails, all the team fails. This game is awfully comptetitive, I would suggest you watch videos, and do research on all heroes before even starting a match. Know when to fight, when to flee, what role your heroe can take. Much of this game is learning what to do and when, after that, is practice, don;t expect to win them all. TL;DR version: This is a "TEAM" game, learn your spot on the team and stick together, awfully competitive experience yet very rewarding.

game-hours: 627.8
review: 10/10 would bang
game-hours: 1442.2
review: To anyone actually bothering to read the review section for the most played game on Steam I would like to say this is a wonderful game with tons of replay and the possiblity to be both the best and worst game you have ever played. Now while the game is fun and (despite what many say) mostly balanced, as in any hero can be beaten through some means that aren't throwing you're entire team at them it also houses some of the worst interactions between players in any game period. Constant hate from anyone who has the ability (or lack there of) to type is common for many games when you commit even the slightest mistake in a game with a notorious learning curve. This will not stop you from playing if you can survive the horrible learning process as when you finally win a game after getting a double rampage you will never be able to stop regardless of how many slurs and racist comments are throw your way when you miss one stun. game-hours: 2266.3
review: Such a strategic game filled with a lot of mysterious beauty from the four corners of the map, which indeed made it phenomenal and remarkable. You get to learn and experience a lot of things with friends and random strangers all over the continent you are situtuated, thus, enhancing your social development. The game requires a strategy to accomplish the goal and wise decision-makings for the welfare of your team which enhances your intellectual development and psychological development. The game could also possibly develop your emotional development as an axiom once said, "The more you get stronger, the more you get kinder." It only has one common goal and that is to destroy all defending towers of the opponents to possibly destroy their throne, but the beauty of it doesn't merely lie on accomplishing those, but also the clashes of your heroes in between small fights and the bond you had with the players that is. Its uniquely created and highly upgraded from its prerequisite, Defense of the Ancients (DotA) which made it a lot more catchy and addicting! From the doodads and props of the map, its terrains, its features, all of it is absolutely fascinating and intriguing! Makes you crave for more games every each other game. I just loved the game just as much as every DotA player do, so I made this review even though it's kinda nonsense just to test my knowledge of the game as well.

game-hours: 987.3
review: strategy team game.. what a nice game..
game-hours: 355.4
review: Dota 2 is one of my favourite games to date. Why? Im not sure. Is it the compelling nature to work as a team, the thrill of a victory of the satisfaction of a great gank? Either way, if my play time is to go by anything (And its only around a modest 200 hours) Dota 2 is an engaging and addictive game for anyone that likes teamwork and a tactical MOBA. The graphics are quite decent, the sound and character design are solid and the gameplay mechanics fluid. Best of all, its 100% free /w the addition of microtransactions to bling out your hero! However, it can be rage inducing when things arent going your way, which can be quite common. This usually takes form of players disconnecting or generally being a little stupid (Ie, running into pinch zones). But never fear, sometimes its all about getting the most enjoyable experience out of a loss you can get (That moment the most stupid death becomes the funniest thing youve seen all day!). To some, it might not be a comical death, and that is expected when (younger) players arent quite sure on whats happening, but they will soon learn (Hopefully). In addition, dota 2 is a free Russian speaking class... Overall, Dota 2 is a solid MOBA with great mechanics, a wonderful player base and glorious moments! 9/10 Would bang

review: So you decide you have no money and you come down to the Free2Play games and you see the game "DOTA 2". My first thought is where's "DOTA 1", but thats just me. Second thought being "why are 500k or more always on this game all the time" . So it must be the best game on the store, right? Well kinda, see it's one of the best F2P games but has some minor bugs in it. Alot of people play this game as I mentioned, meaning the servers sometime have lag due to overload. Also when you log into Dota 2 the volume in the music will jolt and lag to the point you cut the music off. By the way, League of Legends is for you if you hate learning complex controls and have no skill (sry), and Dota 2 is a very complex game that professionals make lots on winning matches and have high high skill. Don't get me wrong LoL has competitions but not the $ prize compared to Dota. When I play Dota 2 I fail to get above 5 kills in a 45min-1hr match, yes I'm a noob :/. My friend he gets over 30 kills on average cause he is epic at this game something I lack xD. (epicness) I DO like the game though but I'm not head-over-heels for it 8/10 (lag problems)

game-hours: 2245.1
review: Are you being tired of being good at any onlinegame you start playing? Are you feeling that after a few hours of playing you could join in a professional clan and take up against the world in that game? Are you looking for a challenge but you don't wanna play darksouls since its mostly singleplayer? Then dota 2 is just for you. Ask around your friends if they have a free key for this game. Every player gets over then dota 2- keys after playing for a certain time. Don't waste money on getting this if your friends inventories are flooded with free gamekeys with no additional value. If you're new to this moba genre, then get ready to open a can of whoop- I mean embarassment and shame. For the first 100 games you get to be a big noob who screws up your own teams strategies. At the start of the match you feel like your even with your teammates but in the endgame you're being blamed for failing your other teammates' possibilities to get better in this game a.k.a. rising up to the higher brackets matches. After them 100 matches you get to be just like the ones who blamed and reported you for playing bad. Soon you'll find yourself reporting every single gamer and writing long novels on the forums how "everyone in my teams sucks every time". The lesson, this game gives to you after all is, we are all the same. Bad gamers are only new to this game and good gamers have played every character over 20 times each. If you're interested in using good strategies and winning matches overpowered, you should be making a team with your friends and start playing together. Communication is the main key in dominating this game.

review: Well for starters, take a look at my total hours played. That should tell you how much I like this game. I honestly find the idea of a MOBA very appealing. Although there might be other games out there in the genre that (dare I say it) are better than DOTA 2, I still find DOTA 2 to be the one game I always go back too. The game mechanics are solid, the character balancing is always changing, adding new depths to the gameplay, and many of the players in DOTA are relatively laid back. Is DOTA 2 the best game in the world? Probably not. Is DOTA 2 the game I have spent 1000+ hours on and will probably spend another thousand on? Absolutely.

review: Really now who gives a  about other games when Dota 2 exists? There won't ever be a remotely as hardcore game as Dota 2. I don't understand why you people bother arguing or having discussions about any other game when there won't be a game as comparably good as Dota 2 for another 10-20 years. I'll put my credibility on the line here, and say that Dota 2 is the best game of all time. By "best game of all time", I refer to artistic and technical production, and gameplay design iteration (since Dota is arguably one of the most iterated upon computer game). From a technological rendering standpoint, it's visuals may not be king, but the art assets, overall art direction, and particle effects are the best that I have ever seen. The most excellently, tastefully produced art that I have ever seen in a game. The voice cast is the best I have ever heard, Dota 2 has Duke Nukem (Jon St. John), Cortana (Jen Taylor), Nathan Drake (Nolan North), the entire L4D cast, the entire Half-Life 2 cast, the entire Team Fortress 2 cast, and GlaDOS from Portal. Let's actually get down to the gameplay. No two games I have ever played have felt similar to the point of feeling rote. Each and every hero in Dota 2 is distinctly different from another, offering a uniquely encapsulated experience with well-defined goals for every single playable character in Dota. Because every hero feels so profoundly unique, every game that I play of Dota 2 feels fundamentally different in a way that League of Legends is not able to reproduce. I could go on, and on, but at this point I might as well just make a video essay. My only regret is that I never played Dota on Warcraft 3, because I wasn't really into gaming when I was younger. Now, I have some Dota 2 to play. Dota 2 is seriously a game I could play ad-inifnitum, and never get tired of. Why bother with any other game?

review: At first, There is Warcraft 3: Frozen Throne released long time ago. The creator was Blizzard Entertainment, one day they got an idea to make simple-strategy-game-without-story-mode. They make a custom map called Defense of the Ancients, and then they rename it into DotA. The guy who created Dota is a legend, he was IceFrog, Blizzard Entertainment Video Game Designer and now he working for Valve and create Dota 2! And from there DOTA 2 WAS BORN! Dota 2 is a good MOBA game, the graphics was good and detailed, very different from Dota 1. They DO NOT copying it, some heroes Valve change the race, but the heroes is not different. BEST VALVE GAME!!! SECOND WAS TF2, AND THEN CS GO! I salute Valve for making this. Difference: Warlock: In Dota 1 he was an Orc, but now a human Storm Spirit: In Dota 1 he was a Panda, now a human or a spirit. And there are severals other heroes THE SPECIALITIES OF DOTA IS IT'S VERY FUN TO PLAY WITH YOUR FRIENDSS!!! And then heroes are fun to play with. I RECOMMEND THIS FOR THOSE WHO PLAY DOTA 1 or STRATEGY GAMESS! But, I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS FOR THOSE WHO LIKE FPS AND TPS-LIKE GAMESS! 8.9/10 GOOD GAME VALVE!      Y

review: One of the best games in existance, but also one of the hardest. It isn't all about reaction timing or how many kills you get, but whether you can use your mind to outplay your opponent and kill the throne. If you persevere, you will get through the raging moments and be rewarded with a sense of accomplishment. But, there is always more to learn. The ability to work as a team is needed (obviously), but people underestimate what a team that supports eachother can really do. If you are up for the challenge then I strongly recommend this game. It isn't too much micro, depending on your hero, which there are 107 different ones to choose from.

review: While it can take awhile to get the hang of this game, as it has a steep learning curve, it is extremely rewarding when it starts to click. It's a challenging game that is fun to play with friends. It's not always going to be sunshine and roses, but it will keep you playing due to the variety of heroes and people that you will meet. Also, what impresses me the most about this game is how balanced it is. There is absolutely no way for someone to purchase an item with real money that will gain them an advantage in the game. All of the items you can buy are purely cosmetic. And the heroes are all quite balanced, and can all be countered. Highly recommend this fun game! Don't be discouraged if it doesn't click right away, it'll get better. :)

review: Excellent game. A real free to play where no one has any advantages over another. The learning curve is steep as there are many heroes to choose from and knowledge of them is essential to perform well, but the in-game tutorial and matchmaking allows for a gradual progression based on your performance. The online resources are amazing: guides for build and strategy, stream of pro player almost every day on various website (joindota, twitch, etc.) and looking at them play helps improve your own gameplay. It's an intricate game full of detaisl which you discover game after game. It might be easier to learn the game with friends!

review: Approaching 2100 hours played...wow. While I do completely agree with the reviews that talk about how bad the community is, I have to say my experience of Dota on the whole has been very enjoyable. The mute option is great, I insta-mute anyone talking crap. Admittedly Dota has an incredibly high learning curve, and you will often find high level players playing on "noob" accounts so even the early matches for new players can be brutal. If you can push through the first couple of hundred hours of games ;) and ignore the torrent of expletives thrown your way when you let the team down!; you will find Dota 2 to be a: competitive, intense, challenging, and completely engaging experience.

game-hours: 2085.6

game-hours: 4349.5
review: ez
game-hours: 394.7
review: After playing at least 50 games of Dota, grasping the basic mechanics and understanding the ablities of about 75% of the over 100 heroes I came to an stunning revelation. The one map isn't just a map, it's a playing field. Dota 2 is more of a sport then any other video game I've played. Each heroe is unique and has a unique playstyle with varying abilities. The graphics look great and the stylized champions each have their own unique lines and looks, some even talk to each other as you play. In Dota 2 each team of 5 starts on either the Radiant (bottom left) or Dire (top right) bases, each base has a giant structure called an ancient with the goal being to destroy the opposing teams ancient. The base splits off into three lanes that converge with their opposing counterparts. Each lane is guarded by three towers divided along the lane. Little units called creeps spawn at the bases and move along the lane to fight each other to the death. Between each lane is a jungle populated by neutral creeps. Killing creeps gives you gold and experience, experience is used to level up your character and gold is used to purchase items. The goal is to use a combination of your hero's abilities, the abilities of your teammates as well as your items to acheive victory. Now what turns a lot of people off from this game is that it has one of the hardest difficulty curves of any game I've played (save for dark souls). You will lose, a lot, when you first start playing. The valve tutorials help you grasp some of the basic concepts and playing vs bots can also help with that, but it's nothing compared to fighting other players on the field. My advice is to get out there and play some games, and if you get stuck there are tons of guides out there to help you find strategies to deal with some of the harded aspects of the game. Most importantly don't worry if you don't understand it at first, after a while the game clicks and it all makes sense. Find a group of friends to play and learn together. It may be intimidating but if you give it a chance Dota 2 is one of the most fulfilling and fun games I've ever played.

review: Dota 2 is many things to many people: it's a great way to kill an afternoon with friends; it's a spectator sport platform with its own item-betting scene; it's a hobby; it's a profession, and a way to make a living. It isn't perfect and likely never will be, as each update tends to fix bugs and introduce new ones, and the tutorial could certainly use some work. However, with zero cost to play and one of the highest skill ceilings of any game I've ever encountered, Dota 2 is a modern multiplayer masterpiece.

review: /10.
game-hours: 2149.7
review: Trial by fire. Straight up. You're going to learn exceptions to the rule by being killed by them, and it's going to happen a lot. Dota is the most brutal learning curve of any game I've ever played. Sometimes in a well-done fashion, sometimes not. There are few games where I can honestly say that at 300 hours you have barely any true idea what you're doing. Amazingly complex game! Tons of fun, especially with friends. Not a casually oriented game at all, but enormously entertaining to play and watch. No grind, no microtransactions that affect gameplay in any way. No outside advantages, no premade skills. Everything happens in game and you need to be quick on your feet. Try it out! Just be warned that properly trying it out will take hundreds of hours. Relax, you're doing fine.

game-hours: 193.0
review: Dota is a great cooperation game that has the goal to destroy the opposing team's ancient to win. However it has many game modes that are fun to play. It may be the same map all the time but it never gets boring. This game also has many systems so new players can get used to it quite fast. However this game has disadvantages as well like bad lobbys because of communication shortages ( european guys who can't speak english, guys who are selfish and just care to win so they just don't care about communication or they may even play with friends in the lobby but they are using the Skype exuse all the time and they are so bored to press a single button so everyone in the team can communicate). Basically the only negative is that there is quite often communication problems among the teams and that some players do care about victory but just play one-man army style , picking their tank character and just do kills and show off.) One big advantage is that the game has no cheats in any lobby. It may have huge disadvantages but the correct lobby and the gameplay can cover the disadvantages often , so i would say that it is a very good game to play that can never get boring even if it's free.

game-hours: 2108.8
review: "Dota 2" is the spiritual sequel to the Warcraft III custom map, Defense of the Ancients. I would describe it as a modern 5v5 version of chess that requires fast thinking and twitch reflexes. The game has a steep learning curve which may scare away casual players who are looking for a more "mainstream" experience (LoL) but the learning is part of the fun because it never stops, the are more than a hundred heroes to choose from and the experience evolves with every patch. The game is completely free to play but you may purchase cosmetic items for your favorite heroes from the Dota store or the community market.
game-hours: 1565.7
review: The MOBA genre is slowly becoming vast and many not so good games are being published, but I assure you this is a great game. However if you are new to the game you must struggle because there are many people transitioning into MOBA's and you may be paired with people who disconnect, like to verbally harrass, but once you get pass level 10 the community slowly turns better. The community is similar to many other MOBA communities, meaning it can be very toxic at times (use the mute button). The game itself is very fun and entertaining especially with friends, grasping items, heros, and skills can be challenging but it is just a proccess of time. If you are patient and willing to play the game it will get funner and funner (till you try to climb ladder and paired with non english speakers). I would give this game a solid 9/10. I like the game so much I wasted 100+ dollars on chest, take it as a lesson don't buy chest, the only winner in that is lord gabe.

review: This is my humble opinion on the game Dota 2, not something you have to agree or argue with! I am playing Dota 2 since 2012/13 and it's still an awesome game. Valve always brings fresh air in the game by patching new heroes and such. For me it's one of the best made games ever because of the big community it's influence on the developers (helping them to fix/add/change things), the gameplay and the teamworkmechanics. You can play how and with whom you want. It's a great game for young and old which always be there without getting boring. I want to list the pros and cons which may help making ones opinion about Dota 2. Pros: - always Patched (fixes/changes/heroes/items, etc.) - not monotonous (always room for creativity) - free (may be the biggest point) - teamplayorientated - large active community - fun (that's what a game is all about) Cons: - difficult to get pretty good/decent player - always glitches, bugs (doesn't affect gamingexperience though) - broken mmr system - high chance of getting addicted (i know what i am talking about :D)

game-hours: 1015.7
review: Uh Not too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes instead Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 3 tablespoons sugar 1 tablespoon baking powder 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg 2 large eggs, at room temperature 1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as needed Now to make it 1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg. 2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla. 3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat. 4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed 5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed. 6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings. Nah great game, highly recomended

game-hours: 56.2
review: I find Dota 2 is a tale of 2 completely different stories. The gameplay is extremely fun, challenging and each game is fresh. However, the community, like almost all MOBAs, is can be terrible, especially for newer players. This is largely due to the fact that the Dota 2 community, as a whole, has an insatiable desire to win. This desire far outweighs common sense, and therefore temper tantrums can flare regularly. The solution? Play with friends. If one does not have friends, I find playing bot games can be fairly enjoyable, as a win is almost guaranteed. Both of these solutions are not perfect, but can allow new players a way to learn and enjoy the game a lot more. I would recommend this to gamers interested in a new type of challenge, and those with friends. You will likely find that you will sink a ton of hours into the game. +Polished gameplay +Blend of strategy and action +Each game is fresh and exciting +Fun with friends -Terrible teammates, trolls or otherwise (the struggle can be real)

game-hours: 915.8
review: The adventure from the WC3 DOTA 1 to Heroes of Newerth to DOTA 2 was an interesting trek. I stopped playing DOTA 1 around the time Batrider was added, stopped playing HoN when Midas was added, and am still playing DOTA 2 to this day. I recall in DOTA 1 when everyone used wc3banlist with auto refreshing slots and autobanning over 100ms players. People never warded, sentries were hardly used and everyone was pretty bad overall. It was a  load of fun however, particularily because so many people I knew were engrossed in DOTA and played nothing else. (Except CS 1.6) Techies remote mining Roshan, feeding your carries with gold (WC3 share gold feature), Phantom Assassin's evasion made her basically invisible minus her shadow... the list goes on. Heroes of Newerth was a title that I hadn't heard of until my friend mentioned it and I got to use his BETA account, shortly after it was launched for $20. Amazing, all the DOTA heroes and items, but with a few new additions every so often. The graphics were much better than DOTA 1 and everything sounded badass. (Portal Key sound is still engrained in my mind.) The problem was that it eventually went F2P with "freemium" features like paid heroes to compete with League of Legends and the DOTA 2 official "open beta" launch. Now we have DOTA 2. Crisp graphics, Valve supremacy, Gaben. Cosmetic only purchasables, very functional UI, solid framerates on any mid-range gaming PC, Valve supremacy, Gaben. I'm just listing the stuff I like. Mirana, smoothness of heroes turning (Suck it, League), Active Items (Suck it again, League), and Valve supremacy. Gaben. Gabe up writing this review because I'm at work and a bunch of customers are here.

game-hours: 80.6
review: DOTA 2 adds a great deal of complexity to the MOBA genre. Its balance tenet is: "Everything goes." There is no character that is underpowered; in fact, they're all overpowered in their own way. The game places a great burden of knowledge over whoever tries it out. Be sure to stick to Co-op games for starters. The tutorial may prepare you slightly, but the game as a whole is a lot more complex than other MOBAs on the market. Oh, and the saying "It ain't over till it's over" applies here. You can't be sure you're winning until the Radiant/Dire goes down. Lots of rooms for comebacks in here, but the game is far more snowbally than other MOBAs.

game-hours: 759.0
review: Dota 2 deserves its intimidating reputation, and it probably wont suit you if youre looking to play casually. Theres a huge time investment before you can even enjoy a game, let alone feel competent at it. But once you start to learn its secrets, theres a wild and exciting variety of play here thats unmatched, even by its peers. Its a challenge of knowledge as well as reflexes, and success is a rush. The fact that its completely and totally free to play in the way we wish all free-to-play games could be isnt just one of the most generous propositions anywhere in gaming, it creates a level playing field where skill and cooperation is paramount. May the best team win.

game-hours: 1045.9
review: This is by far the best game to come from the original DoTA on Warcraft 3. I was disappointed by both LON and HON and after a hiatus of refusing to try anything else I saw this on the free games section and not expecting much installed it. First of all the graphics are wonderful, amazing considering the games free. The game play is almost identical that of DoTA on Warcraft 3 but everything is much smoother and not held back the game platform limition of the original DoTA. The online problems associated with the original game (people leaving etc) is much less as you are rewarded to stay and finish games, but allowed to leave if you have someone who rage quits. The best part in my opinion is how there are the same heroes that I grew to love and hate and learned to play with. There's a ton more to say but honestly in my opinion. This is how DoTA was meant to be and I need never search for another DoTA WC3 Alternative. I thank the developers for this game full heartedly and hope the best for their careers.

review: nc
game-hours: 1070.4
review: As you begin to play this game,you're given a tutorial on how the gameplay works. As you finish completing the tutorial you would have options to either play with bots or with online players. There is a wide variety of modes to choose from. All of the heroes are unlocked from the start so you don't have to unlock them one by one like any other MOBA game. Each heroes have their own specific roles so choose wisely and don't anyhow go whatever you feel like. There is no in-game money in this game and you earned different rewards as you play many matches. There is a lore for you to read for each character if you're interested. However these game have a steep leaning curve and those who are new to MOBA genre will struggle how the gameplay system work. It require a lot of tactics & teamwork in order to win a match........that is if your partner will listen to you cause a lot of player i found will quickly rage at you if you make a minor issue while some other just rage quit because they felt like they cannot make a comeback. A lot of heroes are memorable mainly because sometimes you would see those heroes interact with one another depending if they are rival or allied.

review: There is only one word that can describe this game: Amazing! DoTA is the ultimate MOBA experience offering a large variety of well balanced heroes, suitable for any kind of player. review: From an avid League player, it's a bit hard to get into and understand at first. But once you get your main role going and start to learn the hero's you can play it can get pretty fun. Until you meet Viper... /rage about one of his passives is a slow every auto attack Compared to League it has a lot less skill shots and more lock on's. However there is still a lot of skill to be had at this game, not runes or masteries, denying, and losing some gold upon death. Just make sure you don't spam your spells. Your mana pool is very low and mana regen is little to nothing early game. A very different game with not a lot to compare to, but they're both equally fun in their own way.

review: Looking to cut yourself off from the real world? Life getting too boring for you? Or are you just simply finding for a way to throw your dull life away? Look no further, this game is the game for you. This game promises you hours of fun on end. You fight in a team to claim victory over the enemy team's Ancient, hence the title "Defence of the Ancients". Some heroes are easily grasped, making it easy for beginners to learn the basics. Once you start getting the hang of things and master the basics, there are a hundred other heroes to learn and master. Personally, this game has ruined my life. With about 400 hours of gameplay, my grades have dropped, I have no time to hang out with friends anymore, my family hates me because I'm always in my room, you name it, I'm probably there right now. But I've never been happier in my life. Girlfriend? Sorry, I don't know what that is.

game-hours: 748.6
review: The remake of a popular mod that Valve eventually bought.... like CS or TF2. But that doesn't matter. What matters is that it's a full game of that map that you loved to play on WC3. Better graphics, smoother gameplay, easier matchmaking and items that customize your hero appearance, potrait even spell animations(that actually require money but you can get it by playing). As for gameplay it's much smoother that WC3 and has gorgeos graphics because it runs on a modified source engine. Easier to play, even easier to pick up for new players. And you'll play with people of your skill level. Items are easier to build. Heroes are very well balanced. There is no hero that excells in every area. And no single match is the same. Every match different strategy different heroes and different enemies. Only downside that i really care about is the community. People does not know how to put their language preferences on their native language or the language that they actually speak. Every game you have that 1 or 2 guys that doesn't understand anything you say. Or a bunch of russians that'll rage over every single small mistake you make. SEA NA EUwest EUeast servers are all full of Russians. Russians are everywhere except for the Russian server. And while i'll admit that there are some good Russians who speak english and actually communicates with their team and not yell  BLYAT through their mic, but they're not that common. Overall good game, very well balanced. I give Dota 2 9/10. Recommended game but beware of the russians..........or pinoys.........or brazillians(or so i've heard).

game-hours: 277.5
review: Originally a Warcraft 3 mod, this highly influential arena style game has inspired many spin offs including the acclaimed League of Legends. Unlike League of Legends however, you can control all 112 heroes when you buy the game, and there is no "pay to win" features at all; all bonus items are purely cosmetic and for fun. The community can even create content that can be acquired in game! The only shortcoming to DotA is that it will be a little more difficult to pick up compared to League of Legends. Given the chance however, DotA2 will prove to be a much more balanced and skill-oriented experience, with meaningful item and ability selection and a more dynamic gold farming game which both provide superior short and long term strategic gameplay. Try the one that started it all, you won't be disappointed!
game-hours: 622.5

game-hours: 1002.0
review: Dota 2 is a masterpiece of competitive gaming. Endlessly replayable due to its incredible depth, the game truly never gets old. Continuous support ensures that the game never gets stale, with a constantly changing meta. Dota 2 has a steep learning curve, but once you find your way, there is no other game like it. Few games are as painful to lose, but inversely, as satisfying to win, as Dota 2. Unparalled strategic and mechanical depth ensure that no player will ever be as good as they can be in any one game, yet it is incredibly satisfying to strive for perfection through continued play. Strategy is deeply involved before you even "begin" the game, with hero selection, all the way through to the end of the match. Certain heroes work particularly well against others, are weak to others, and coordinate exceptionally with others. This is due to the array of unique abilities that each hero possesses, and the role they fill on their team. Once the game begins, players must coordinate with their team members in order to play most effectively. This is done in combat, as well as in what item purchases players decide to make. Strategy is extensively involved in item purchases, combat, and positioning. Players must constantly react to the game in order to play effectively, and since no game is ever the same, the experience is always different, making each game a fresh experience, and one that I will continue to enjoy for as long as I can foresee.

game-hours: 426.8

game-hours: 337.1
review: Defense of the Ancients 2 - known more colloquially as DotA 2 - is a masterpiece of modern video game design. Harkening back to the age-old StarCraft 1 custom map Aeon of Strife, DotA 2 nearly perfects the elements introduce in that original mod. The mechanics and gameplay are ageless, simple in their implementation and flawless in their execution. Everything about Dota 2 is a triumph of engineering - the individual Heroes have fantastic character designs, both thematically and mechanically, and the game is perfectly balanced around its seemingly lack of scaling and at times stagnant nature. It is a game where Levels and Planning take precedent over Gold Advantage and Items, and teamwork is a union - a celebration, even - of independent player skill. This variety of complex mechanics, themes, and interactions that coalesce into a truly unique experience. I recall the time I forgot to Ward bot rune, and when mid lost Illusion to a Pudge from top lane, I was only blamed four times, as opposed to dozens in other, similar competing games. This unparalelled level of community benevolence and powerful inclination towards skillful play make DotA 2 the best game on the market, if not all of Human History. Four hundred years from now, when the Paragon Hyperscholars are uploading DigiEdu to the modbrains of the Neo Bourgeoisie, Dota 2 will forever be imbedded in the SiliconCortex as the zenith of PreHuman ingenuity. 0/10 it sucks

review: A very fun game with a ridiculously good f2p model. (Basically, you can get any item you want through random drops, or from trading with other players.) It is a very complicated game however, much harder than it's counterpart League of Legends. Pros -Many heroes -All heroes are unlocked at the start -Very precise balancing -A lot of different strategies and ideas -Very large community (most popular game on Steam) -Very little issues, even on my barely-gaming rig Cons -complicated, and it takes a while to learn all the mechanics -tutorial can be a little vague or dense -One player can ruin a whole game (Inherent of all games in this genre) -Extremely hostile or crude community -Lacks any form on region lock, and the report system is barely functional This game functions very well, and truly deserves it's crown of the most popular game on steam. Long live Dota! 4.5/5 9/10

review: After years of waiting, fans of the League of Legends franchise have finally gotten what they've been waiting for: League of Legends 3: The Fall of Demacia. In this thrilling conclusion to the loved League of Legends trilogy, Riot Games have yet again shaken the MOBA genre to its core. In this game, the player returns to playing in three dimensions, rather than two like in League of Legends 2. Throughout the game, Riot has expertly woven in FPS and RPG segments that add a change of pace to the player's adventure. As League of Legends 3: The fall of Demacia has simply too many new features to be covered in my lowly review, I highly recommend that the reader purchases this game. I give this game a 11.5/12.

game-hours: 1901.8
review: k.
game-hours: 454.8
review: Dota 2, or Defense of the Ancients 2 is a great free to play game, keeping real to the original mod of warcraft 3. Many people don't know the origins but this title began as a game-mod for warcraft 3. It was so intuitive and successful that it spawned an entire multiplayer online battle arena (or MOBA) genre. Basically, it is a game created, maintained, funded, promoted and played solely by gamers. To know that this formula has lead it into a limelight of success is a warm feeling to anyone involved. The support this game has received has been phenomenal, though the concept is fairly simple. Dota 2 is a professional game experience, much like a game of baseball or football. The stage is set in an online computer regulated fantasy battlefield arena which makes the action more interesting and the gameplay more fair. Players join together in groups of five to take on opponents casually with public matchmaking or by forming professional competitive teams. Each player picks from a rooster of 100+ heroes each with unique abilities and statistics. Players then battle on a field of war, where the two npc armies release waves of troops to engage each other. This is where the game refines itself, though the stage does not change each battle is unique and requires great concentration and mastery to defeat your enemy. To become successful does require a certain level of prowess, so it is recommended new players begin by trying out a couple hundred public matchmaking games. You might think I'm joking, but that is just the start of the journey. As you become more successful your rankings will increase, making you more attractive for recruiters. Unless you already have a team formed and have had previous competitive experience, you might not be immediately ready for high level gameplay. Do not be discouraged, however! The game is great about teaming you up with players of your own skill level. Because the game is team based by nature, it is natural to meet new friends online to play with. It is important to be courteous and not overly rude, because your reputation spreads. If you are friendly and assist your team-mates, they may grant you after battle accolades or want to become your friend. If you are rude and flaming, your team-mates will work against you or sometimes quit altogether. In your early stages it is important to be open and respectful. If you're not sure what to do don't be afraid to ask. The game features an awesome built in microphone system, so if you own the hardware talking to your opponents is as easy as a click. As you complete more battles you earn more rewards, experience, accolades and friends. Rewards include special items and equipment for your heroes. Special effects and modifications to the user interface and stage design. Custom load screens, custom courier graphics, custom animations and plenty of exclusives which can be bought and sold on the steam market! Probably the only downfall here is the high intensity and length these games operate on. It is not unusual for a good game to take hours to complete. Sometimes it can be really heart pounding when you have a close game and both teams are equally matched. The minions flood the screen and team battles clash on, eventually leading a single team to victory. Though the game lacks a lot of what a traditional game is expected to have it is still a full experience. Dota 2 has come a long way and its ambition as a flagship for competitive gamers is something to respect. Its an awesome experience to be part of. Having the full support of steam and by having content designed by the player base, we see a role for anyone who is not successful with the sometimes overly competitive aspect. Much of the reason the original defense of the ancients was successful was because the community had such a large input into the designs of the game. Often the developers recruited within the games player base or other well known modders to help design their masterpiece. Today's Dota 2 sees even larger support, having systems in place to collect almost all 3d model submissions. When new heroes are designed players are both testers and developers of expansion content. This experience makes you feel in touch with the game. Ultimately however, this game is for the players. Battles are tough and the more experienced you become the more difficult opponents you will become matched with. There comes a point where being matched against a fully microphoned team is going to become common. Because I have played this game for so long and know a lot about it, I am not immediately put off by this. However, be warned prolonged exposure to Dota 2 is definitely not a casual experience. Though I always recommend one conduct themselves in the best manor for an optimum experience, you will encounter those who do not agree with these principles. Dota 2 has become a source of income for some, so it is important to those individuals to never lose. If you dont really care if you win or lose and are just looking for a quick way to pass the time, this game can provide you and a group of friend tons of fun. If you are looking to follow the road of success, prepare for a difficult journey. I definitely recommend Dota 2 for all gamers that would call themselves competitive. It is simple, sleek and sexy. Highly appealing and easy to pick up. Best of all, free and highly compatible and supported. Link directly up to your steam account and find out which of your friends play already. You might be surprised! Spending money in this game almost always results in only ascetic changes. This game is definitely not a pay to win game! In fact, one might even generate your own steam dollars by selling the items won from this game! Download it today!

review: I started playing dota long ago and my life became progressively worse. I gained weight rapidly, I began isolating myself from social interactions and the little interactions I did participate in - I was very rude and racist towards anyone who even looked at me. Then I quit because reasons. Then my life started improving. I lost most of the weight I gained, I was dating, I got a nice job and I excelled in all my university classes. Then Dota2 came out. I was given a beta key and it sat in my steam inventory for many months taunting me. It's red glow symbolizing some deep-seated temptation that made me think of nefarious djinns of stories long forgotten. So inviting and so beautiful. But I knew it's secrets and I knew what those secrets did to me. But sadly even the strongest and tallest mountain will eventually fall and crumble to the gentle peppering of rain. After the five-hundreth (im lying, it was like 3 probs) demand that I start playing, my willpower gave in and fell into the blackness once again. I could feel some etheral blackness grasp its fingers around my still-recovering mind. As the game finished installed and I pressed that 'Play Now' button, I realized that I just jumped off the bridge that I was so very carefully constructing ever since quitting the first DOTA. Everything came rushing back to me. One game became ten and ten games became one-thousand. My girlfriend when I began again has left me already and I feel nothing but pity for her because she only wants me to leave the one I trulty love. I'm gaining weight again but whatever, I dont even care . i remember liek when my friend was like, "wanna come party after exams?" and i was like no  that lol i have an ih to do i skipped some exams tho cuz i didnt rly have much time to study cuz ti3 was hapepning and i wanted to watch enough games so i wuldnt be mad that i msised it. but i had to quit cuz im failing university and its gettin 2 expensive 2 live in campus. otherwise 10/10 good game i have 700 hours logged into dota2 and im still casual as

review: loads of fun, lot to learn; Dota 2 offer you an addiction you cannot find in other games. from denying enemy's farm to split pushing lanes in order to take down enemy's tower, the amount of elements to learn in this game is so many that you cannot help yourself to get hooked (pun intended) and never get tired by the fascinating world of Dota 2. this game offers various gameplay strategy which makes you hardly getting bored of playing Dota 2; you can play as a carry(hitter) to farm fancy weapons and wreck the enemy to their core or you can also play as a support to assist the progress of your team mate's carry(s) and protect them from dying or you can also be a pusher to easily take down enemy's tower and path your way to win with fast paced fashion. the possibility seems to be limitless with Dota 2.

review: Don't get me wrong Dota 2 is a great game, however when you start playing this game you will be beaten with cludgels the size of The empire state. As you play somewhat 20 hours of it you start to figure out how ot actually play. It is heavily rewarding and enables you to enjoy yourself alot more. It takes skill and intelligence to play well and you always learn new things. There are so many phases of skill you go through, this being said as you get constantly better you change in the way you play, you think faster and your reaction time decreases. Its one of those things you do not realise unless you review how you have played. Also i recommend not playing this list of heroes as they require no skill to play and are exceptionally over powered: Sniper ..... his ult is op aswell as his range. Ursa ..... applies fury swipes to target (increases damage done to target after every consecutive hit) Drow ranger ..... Slows you like seriously 50% slow on hit of a maxed out frost arrow. Riki ..... Permenant invis, you get used to being safe while invis but beware if someone actually knows how to play dota they will buy wards or a gem of true sight and then you will be useless Viper .... slows you even more than drow axe .... just is generally op Don't play them as you feel amazing when you do well with them then again they take no skill to play, should be nerfed. League of Losers is easier than dota but less rewarding! One of the best games on steam.

review: First review.. So Dota2, where to begin. Firstly, it is a fantastic game, which community is growing rapidly. With the up coming TI4, there really isn't a greater time to join the game. The range of heros is a good amount, not too many that it would be impossible for someone from the team of 5 for there to be an unused hero. The one thing that lets the game down is new players. Now im not saying new players are all bad and should stop playing the game. I think we (experienced players) need to help them, maybe have an academy option of some sort meaning new players are able to be coached by experienced players before they enter match making. This is what I did when I began playing the game a few years ago and something I have done in turn teaching new players. That would be my only advice to new players learn from experienced team mates. If your friendly and dont ignore what they tell you they wont get angry.

game-hours: 2153.1
review: Dota 2 is one of the biggest moba on market, so when it comes to a big player it has some pros and cons. First of all i've played many "Free to play" games but this one must say is a real FREE TO PLAY. In many others games u can spend some real cash on boosters which are giving u advantage on the battlefield but in Dota you "wasting" all your money only on a hero's appearance. Of course u can buy a boost here which will give u more experience from the match BUT THIS ONLY INCREASES your cosmetic items loot. Also forgot to mention that every item from the shop can be looted via match rewards. Second of all Dota 2 was my first moba type game, i was never interested in mobas, never played mobas until i decided to try dota when it was in beta. Even in beta game was "newbie-friendly". First i've played matches vs bots (all diff) then moved to matches vs bots in coop with other players. And then i was ready for the BIG ONE. Later Valve added a nice tutorial for new players to moba games. But anyway most of new people dont care about this, i've checked this on playin on new steam account which queded me with low level of dota 2 (not low level of skill) players and i've met some pretty interesting people right there like carry wisp etc. FInally i must get to the biggest con of Dota 2. For me European player the biggest CON of dota 2 are russians (no im not a racist). Ok to get things smooth i not saying Russia country is all made of bunch of morons but this game really makes me think like this. Russians are the biggest and worst plague of DOTA 2 community. In my all match history which i've played something around 2.5k matches russians were active in like 75% of this number. In 1% of this matches i have met russians who can speak english and can even teamplay the rest of them are non speaking english, selfish players who will always play solo and when you gonna lost game then "its raining ". Dota 2 forum is filled with posts that russians are crashin this game but Valve dont even bother to do something with this. Ending i must say Dota 2 is a solid, newbie-friendly game with some comunnity problems. I absolutely commend this game to all moba fans and not only them.

game-hours: 517.7
review: One of the best multiplayer online battle arena game; its gameplay focuses on combat in a three-dimensional environment, presented from an oblique high-angle perspective. What I liked on this game is that this is played in discrete matches involving two five-player teams, each of which occupies a stronghold at a corner of the map. Each stronghold contains a building called the "Ancient", which the opposite team must destroy to win the match. Each player controls a "Hero" character and focuses on leveling up, collecting gold, acquiring items and fighting against the other team to achieve victory.

game-hours: 4698.1
review: I am an omnivorous gamer (or was), that not only includes pc games but also most indoor games. I dont miss any computer game that passes through my way. And one day Dota came in front of me. I started playing Dota with sky high expectations because of its review and recommendation from my friends who play Dota, and I was surprised, because there is no review no depiction and absolutely no trailer or game play clip that can actually show u the true face, the real picture of brilliance and the utterly satisfying awesomeness of Dota, U have to play it to know it. This is the ultimate gaming experience. I felt like all the games I played through my life were actually meant to lead me to Dota. Now I play no game but Dota, and I am pretty sure that I am going to spend a considerably unbelievable amount of my time with it. In the free to play documentary someone said that Dota is a combination of chess and soccer. I liked the phrase but I want to redesign the phrase: Dota is the combination of chess, monopoly, football, martial arts, poker etc and all the computer games u have ever played. And these things in a form of an ultimate team sport. Playing Dota is mostly about knowledge, skill, economy, team spirit, synchronization of your brain with your hands, judgment, anticipation and many many things that I dont know yet. Go Dota if u think of yourself as a true and passionate gamer.

review: DotA 2 is a MOBA game which is the so called sequel to the Warcraft III mod DotA. Surprising both old and new players alike as to how good it is compared to others or to it's predecessor. DotA 2 is a game which is utterly repetitive, who am I kidding? Same map, same items, same heroes every single time but I never got bored or got sick of it, more like this is the reason I play it so much, to be better at the same map, using the same items and heroes at every other fight. (I play it weekly for about 8 hours, yeah 8 is my favorite #) All in all a great MOBA game, maybe the best. Better graphics than its competitors and definitely more balanced in terms of both heroes and items.

review: hello
game-hours: 1173.9
review: Dota 2 is a very extensive and deep game but this depth and complexity in my opinion means a great ceiling of fun. I really enjoy this game. You can play as an oblivious person with your oblivious friends and derp around the game and have lots of fun trying to bash each others heads in while trying to break that coveted ancient, but be warned; if you enjoy this game you might want to try playing online. Playing online is a different experience ENTIRELY. Team work becomes so much much oh ever so much much so muchly much much more crucial than before (Dr.Suess reference XD) If you are still playing with your group of friends though at this point that should help a lot. But like many people (myself included) you will be in games where you are alone amongst 4 strangers All of whom have their own agenda seemingly (it is not ALWAYS like this.) you will try your best to help your team win but it will inevitably end in a couple of your teammates being head-strong idiots who fed the other team (let the other team kill them to many times) then the fed team is big bad and bulky, then you lose. There are games where you and your team will work together and you will DESTROY!!! that will not always be the case so enjoy it when it happens and get over it when it doesn't. If you plan on being great at this game be prepared to spend hours researching what the items do; all of the recipes, heroe's skills (especially ultimates), and watch games of people who are good (I reccomend Purge he's on YouTube.) If all this seems overwhelming it's because this game can be CRAZY overwhelming however it has potential to be CRAZY fun! The bottom line is what you put into this game is what you will get out of it; at the time of this review i have 270+ hours in-game and I still feel relatively noobish; I have been having fun this whole time however. So if you don't feel like putting away crazy amounts of time into a game then i suggest you get 1-9 friends who also don't know how DOTA works to get this game and just play private games together and have a BLAST because it is quite a lot of fun. A little about me. I played DOTA 1 the Warcraft III mod as a late-comer with 1 other friend game after game and we derped PLENTY But through those games I learned about the stats and recipes of about 90% of the items in the game, giving me a pretty sizable advantage. I could have made this review about ten times longer but then it would have been a guide... (it already kind of is) 10/10 by the way this game is great!

game-hours: 37.2

game-hours: 43.8
review: This is an excellent game. For Warcraft 3 lovers, who have played the original DOTA, this will blow you away. There have been a lot of improvements to the overall gameplay, balancing, item modification, hero selection, and overall purpose to the game. For players new to DOTA, not only is this game free to play, (with some purchasable items in game that have no effect on the outcome of the game, just cosmetics), but it is very easily learned, a lot of fun, and it is a game that can be played in about 45 minute intervals. The DOTA Profile is also a great feature, leveling you up as you gain experience so you can be matched with players that are relatively the same skill level you are. It also includes some fun information, like who your most successful heroes were, your win/loss record, and items that you want to feature. Coaching/Spectating is a great new feature from the original DOTA Warcraft 3 Map, because you can have experienced players come in and watch you play, coaching you. You can set it to where you can only listen to that person and no one else, providing personalized instruction. Hero Build/ Item Build is awesome, you can literally create customized builds for your heroes that can be used through the entire steam community. If you're learning a hero you've never played, selecting a community build is a great way to learn. There are many other features, and many other reasons to give the game a try. Whether your an old hat at DOTA, or looking for a change of pace, this game is for you.

review: As someone who had never played the original Dota for Warcraft 3 and had only played League of Legends prior to the release of Dota 2, I can safely say it's worth the switch. The game was a little daunting at first to get learn but Valve offer plenty of ways to learn, such as their tutorial system or bot match, even better now they added the in-game user guide menu which makes everything so much easier. There is a huge selection of heroes to pick from, each unique and fun to play including roles I wouldn't normally touch such as support, I honestly don't mind it in this game because it's fun. Every aspect of this game seems to be done really well, and it doesn't seem like Valve is stopping on the updates anytime soon. The only negative thing I can say about this game is the community, but theses days if you play online you can expect that in any game.

game-hours: 561.4
review: Two teams of five fight across three lanes. Three specific types of shop sell sixty different magical items. There are more than a hundred characters to play, and an unknown quantity still to come. Eight types of specific role that you can play as part of your team. Its safe to say that Dota 2 is a game of numbers. Despite Valves best efforts to ease players in gently, Dota 2 is an inherently overwhelming game. The first few hours of this MOBA are relentlessly bemusing, but after that the difficulty curve becomes smoother - giving you a tangible sense of how youll get better. Each match tends to last somewhere between 30 minutes and an hour, offering vast amounts of entertainment if youve got the time. Lengthy games can cause frustration when things arent going well, however, which is the main source of Dota 2s rep for breeding a virulent strain of internet . Losing isnt frustrating if youre learning something new, and getting to know every character will take roughly 100 hours. Its also worth mentioning that you really get to know them - the vocal work and animations are superb, giving Dota 2 some of the best character design in gaming. Over the next 50 hours it becomes clear that Dota 2s complexity isnt pointless PC-RPG-posturing. Every character, skill, and item serves a purpose. Its a pleasant surprise to find that its depth doesnt damage the clarity of the design. Gold buys you items and XP levels characters up, but in contrast to the messy fashion in which the RPG genre has incrementally evolved, Dota 2s purity shines. Whilst too impenetrable to entice non-savvy spectators, theres no doubting the games quality as an E-sport. Youll need knowledge, skill, and a smidge of spider-sense. Friends to learn with are a must, and dont be deceived by the lack of a pricetag: Dota 2 will cost you hundreds of hours.

game-hours: 1158.2
review: It is the best of games, it is the worst of games. There hasn't be a game in recent years that is equally likely to make you swear at the screen and idiotic teammates, as it is to make you smile and laugh when stuff goes well. I guarantee every game will produce emotion, even if some of those are better left unfelt. Just don't punish the hardware you're playing on, it's not to blame. And the first couple dozen games you play, you will hate it. And your team will hate you. And you'll be told to delete dota and kill yourself. And because you're persistent and don't take crap from random morons on the internet, you will ignore them and get better at the game purely out of spite. It's a great game. Let the other player's hatered fuel your desire to improve, and you will get better.

game-hours: 3000.6
review: If youre looking for a reason to commit time to Dota 2  if youre actually reading this review for advice and a critical opinion, rather than to see what score Im going to give the most popular game on Steam  then, first up, thanks for being here. Second, I want you to consider what it means when two grown men accidentally lather each other in regenerative goop. Its gamings equivalent of holding a door open for somebody who is already reaching to hold the door open for you: a synchronicity of kindness that speaks to a deeper shared understanding of the situation both people are in. Dota is a game where you can say the words are you thinking what Im thinking? and be reliably assured that the person on the other end of your VoIP connection actually is. It might have the systems and bearing of a videogame, but Dota shares the social impetus of a sport. Its single environment isnt a map, its a pitch.

review: NC game
game-hours: 768.7
review: I made a recommendation for DotA 2 a while back, but that was when I was awful at the game. Now, that I am not awful, I can accurately explain why this is one of the greatest games I have ever played. (Good = +, Neutral = o, Bad = -) + Over 100 Unique Heroes, and, the roster is still growing! + Thousands of items to fully customize your Heroes + So many Heroes, that there is a great chance you will find your favorite one. + Hilarious announcers. o Some people of the community are asshats + So many ways to make your playstyle unique with in-game items. + Many online modes that will keep you busy + Extremely time consuming to level up, so, a level 30 isn't something you see often. Until recently of course, they had an update which make's it extremely easy to level up from 1-10. Which I dislike, I feel as if we earlier players deserve compensation, but it's not that big of a deal. + Everytime you level up, you have the chance to unlock rarer items. + Everytime you level up, you get awarded an item. + Items can be found just by playing ranked/pub matches. + Portal Pack/Stanley Parable Pack + Game is updated constantly, fixing bugs, and adding new content. + ABSOLUTELY FREE! o Addicting, which in turn will make you spend your money on in-game content. Which is of course your fault and in no way the game's fault, but it's still like a hypnotic spell. + Absolutely beautiful visuals. + Very strategic gameplay. + Great soundtrack. o Getting started can be a pain, unless you have the time, or a friend to help you. + Doesn't publish your losses, which can occassionally ruin troll's. + Even if you win or lose a match, Battle Points are handed out equally, and drop rate is the same for everybody, so, losing really isn't too much of a big deal. But, as of recent, big Battle Point Booster's are around, I have a friend who is level 7 but only has 10 game's played, I remember when I was level 7, I had around 100 game's played... it's quite annoying. + Valve allows users to create items for the game, and if your item is picked, you will get payed by Valve, and your item will be put in the game. + Matches you with people your level, so you won't be fighting a level 55. + Even if you don't notice, after playing this game, you will gradually get much better, sadly, you won't be able to notice in ranked/pub matches, since you get matched with people your level. Play this for a while, and fight one of your new friends, you will surprise yourself. + Warcraft inspired Heroes, which is incredible, since I was a big fan of Warcraft. If you don't like games that involve competing, or you easily rage quit, this isn't the game for you. But, if you're fine with rage quits, and difficult opponents, you will love this game, it's fun, and, even after 600+ hours of playing, I am still doing things I have never done before... DotA 2 Deserves 10 Kats all over it's pretty little Ancient... out of 10
